description: It displays the data to the user.

description: It represents the data and business logic.

description: It provides methods to simplify view code.

description: A feature to prevent mass assignment vulnerabilities.

title: What is CSRF?

description: It serves as the base class for all controllers.

description: It serves as the base class for all controllers.

title: What are routes?
description: They define the paths in your application.

title: What is the purpose of the config directory?
description: It contains configuration files for the Rails app.

title: How to use environment variables?
description: Store sensitive data like API keys in environment variables.

title: What is a namespace?
description: It allows you to group controllers under a common module.

title: Explain the difference between GET and POST.
description: GET requests data, POST sends data to be processed.

title: How to implement pagination?
description: Use pagination gems like kaminari or will_paginate.

title: What are callbacks in ActiveRecord?
description: Methods that get called at certain points in the lifecycle of an object.

title: What is a join table?
description: A table that associates two other tables in a many-to-many relationship.

title: What is a polymorphic association?
description: An association that can refer to multiple other models.
